The rooms are very spacious and very cozy and the master had a really nice shower that a lot of the girls in our group really liked. I was also told about some new upgrades coming to the house soon. The weather was not very good on our first day but we never felt the need to go out and find something’s to do as we were allowed to use everything in the house including some of their pedal and paddle boats, ping pong table etc. During all my stay with Airbnb I have either had a great house or a great host, in our stay at this lake house we got a chance to stay at a beautiful home and interacted with even more beautiful hosts. Really happy to have greeted this way and nothing but just nice things to say about the house and the host. Do visit this place as we would be thinking about it again as well to go back sometime again in the future.

review_text:
I was needing to escape the pressures of regular life for a few days and was looking for a place to relax, on very short notice. I came across Tony's cottage, which looked perfect for my needs, including the price. Tony responded to my inquiry within an hour, and was, thankfully, able to accommodate me and my dog on such short notice.
Tony was there to greet me when I arrived, and he made sure I knew where things were and that I had everything I needed. He's very friendly and did a great job at being very available when/if I needed him, while still being very respectful of my need for solitude.
The cottage was everything I expected, and more. The pictures don't really do the inside justice, as the main rooms were much larger than I expected, especially the gorgeous sunroom facing the lake. When inside, I spent nearly all my time in there, including sleeping on the day bed so I could have the view of the beautiful lake as soon as I woke up. The bed in the master bedroom looked really comfortable, even if I didn't sleep in it. The place can easily sleep 7 or 8. It was also nice to have a fully functioning kitchen, and a washing machine and dryer, even though I didn't need to use it.
Outdoors, there's a really nice, large lawn, keeping neighbors not too close together. When I was there in early March, I had complete privacy. There was only 1 other occupied cottage on the same road. The lake was nearly all melted and I saw several geese and ducks on the water, as well as a couple swans. There is a lot of outdoor seating available, my favorite being the swing from the tree.
I really hope to spend more time at the cottage when it warms up. It looks like a great swim spot and I would love to put that kayak to use! I also just love the sounds of crickets and frogs at night, so I need to come back for that! It's the best thing to fall asleep to IMO, and makes for a really restful sleep.
Thanks again, Tony!
